intro: Allium cristophii subsp. golestanicum, commonly known as the Golestan garlic, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Iran. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous structure and distinctive, often purple-tinged flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of clustered, bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
